---
title: "export_default_and_foo.json"
---

## High-level description
This JSON file contains configuration data for feature flags and segments across two namespaces: "default" and "foo". It defines flags with various types, rules, and segments, which are likely used for feature toggling and A/B testing in a software application.

## Code Structure
The file consists of two JSON objects, each representing a namespace with its associated flags and segments. The structure is hierarchical, with namespaces containing flags and segments, and flags containing variants, rules, and rollouts.

## Symbols

### Namespace
#### Description
Represents a logical grouping of flags and segments.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the namespace |
| name | string | Human-readable name for the namespace |
| description | string | Brief description of the namespace |

### Flag
#### Description
Defines a feature flag with its properties, variants, rules, and rollouts.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Human-readable name for the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., "VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE", "BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE") |
| description | string | Brief description of the flag |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is currently enabled |
| variants | array | List of variants for the flag (for VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE) |
| rules | array | List of rules for flag evaluation |
| rollouts | array | List of rollout configurations (for BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE) |

### Variant
#### Description
Represents a variant of a flag, potentially with an attachment containing additional data.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the variant |
| name | string | Human-readable name for the variant |
| attachment | object | Optional additional data associated with the variant |

### Rule
#### Description
Defines a rule for flag evaluation, including segment and distribution information.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| segment | string or object | Segment key or complex segment definition |
| distributions | array | List of distribution configurations for variants |

### Rollout
#### Description
Defines a rollout configuration for boolean flags.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| description | string | Brief description of the rollout |
| segment | object | Segment configuration for the rollout |
| threshold | object | Threshold configuration for percentage-based rollouts |

### Segment
#### Description
Defines a segment of users or entities for targeted flag evaluation.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Human-readable name for the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching to be used (e.g., "ANY_MATCH_TYPE") |
| description | string | Brief description of the segment |
| constraints | array | List of constraints defining the segment |

### Constraint
#### Description
Defines a constraint for segment evaluation.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | Type of comparison (e.g., "STRING_COMPARISON_TYPE") |
| property | string | Property to be evaluated |
| operator | string | Comparison operator (e.g., "eq", "neq") |
| value | string | Value to compare against |
| description | string | Brief description of the constraint |

## Configuration
The file defines two namespaces with their respective flags and segments:

1. Default namespace:
   - Contains two flags: "flag1" (VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE) and "flag2" (BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE)
   - Defines two segments: "segment1" and "segment2"

2. Foo namespace:
   - Contains the same two flags and segments as the default namespace

Both namespaces have identical flag and segment configurations, suggesting that this file might be used for testing or as a template for multiple environments.

## API/Interface Reference
While this is not an API definition, the structure of the JSON objects implies an interface for feature flag management:

| Entity | Properties | Description |
|:-------|:-----------|:------------|
| Namespace | key, name, description, flags, segments | Defines a group of related flags and segments |
| Flag | key, name, type, description, enabled, variants/rollouts, rules | Defines a feature flag with its evaluation logic |
| Segment | key, name, match_type, description, constraints | Defines a user segment for targeted flag evaluation |

This structure allows for complex feature flag configurations, including variant testing, targeted rollouts, and segmented user groups.
